name: scrot
description:
scrot (SCReenshOT) is a simple command line screen capture utility that
uses imlib2 to grab and save images. Multiple image formats are
supported through imlib2's dynamic saver modules.

dependencies.name: giblib
dependencies.description:
Giblib is a simple library which wraps imlib2's context API, avoiding
all the context_get/set calls, adds fontstyles to the truetype renderer
and supplies a generic doubly-linked list and some string functions.

dependencies.name: imlib2

Library that does image file loading and saving as well as rendering,
manipulation, arbitrary polygon support

dependent_to.name: py-pyscreeze
dependent_to.description:
PyScreeze can take screenshots, save them to files, and locate images
within the screen. This is useful if you have a small image of, say, a
button that needs to be clicked and want to locate it on the screen.
